value.name: Tablespoon - Wikipedia
value.snippet: A tablespoon (tbsp. , Tbsp. , Tb. , or T.) is a large spoon. In many English-speaking regions, the term now refers to a large spoon used for serving; however, in some regions, it is the largest type of spoon used for eating. By extension, the term is also used as a cooking measure of volume.

value.name: Measurement unit conversion: tablespoon [metric]
value.snippet: Tablespoon [metric] is a measure of volume. Get more information and details on the 'tablespoon [metric]' measurement unit, including its symbol, category, and common conversions from tablespoon [metric] to other volume units.

value.name: Convert ml to tablespoon [metric] - Conversion of Measurement Units
value.snippet: We assume you are converting between milliliter and tablespoon [metric]. You can view more details on each measurement unit: ml or tablespoon [metric] The SI derived unit for volume is the cubic meter. 1 cubic meter is equal to 1000000 ml, or 66666.666666667 tablespoon [metric].

value.name: Spoon Measurements & Conversions
value.snippet: Tablespoon & Teaspoon Size in Millilitres The table below gives the equivalent in millilitres (ml) for tablespoons, dessertspoons and teaspoons (results are given to 2 decimal places). Notes: Spoon sizes in the US are commonly based on the tablespoon being ½ fl oz and the teaspoon being one third of a tablespoon

value.name: How Many Teaspoons in a Tablespoon? Measurement Conversion Chart
value.snippet: Tablespoons and teaspoons are units of volume that are handy for measuring smaller amounts of ingredients (e.g. spices, oils, vanilla extract) that wouldn’t be practical to weigh on a scale and are too small to measure in cups. They are essential to cooking and baking and used in both the metric and imperial systems.

value.name: What is a metric tablespoon [metric tbsp], a unit of volume - Aqua-Calc
value.snippet: The metric tablespoon is a unit of measurement of volume Metric tablespoon is a metric (SI) liquid measure of volume.
